website_summaries.verdict: Stretchy, versatile gloves that can handle just about any temperature your kitchen or grill can cook up.
pros: Long cuffs prevent your wrists from accidental burns
Stretchy gloves that don't impede movement
cons: One-size-fits-all gloves may be too small for you if you have large hands

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Heat Resistant Gloves for 'small' hands
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these heat resistant gloves. I have small hands and wear about size 6 or 7 gloves. Every pair of oven gloves or mitts I tried on were way too big. Although the photo shows a young girl wearing them, they are perfect for a woman with smaller hands. They're great for handling hot dishes or pots, but are porous and would not protect from hot liquids. For my purpose, they're exactly what I was looking for and I am thrilled to finally have found oven gloves that fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: buffettfan

customer_reviews.title: These Heat Resistant Glove Actually Work as Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful ... and they actually work to keep the head down to a workable level! I say this, because I have tried multiple other Gloves and Mitts and other devices for holding hot dishes right out of the oven, and ONLY this Grill Heat Aid Heat Resistant Gloves actually have come through and worked as advertised. That is not to say that you can't feel the heat, but you will have the time to pick up and carry your hot dishes right out of the oven to another place that is maybe five or ten steps away without worrying about burning yourself! Great job, SMM Group ... you have a really fabulous product here!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, but a little big. Would like to see a couple sizes instead of one-size-fits-all. Deals with heat well! Almost unbelievable. You can grab ahold of the hot grate and move it around, no problem. You might feel a VERY slight warm temp increase but that's all. But you can't hold on to the REALLY hot stuff too long or it will start burning the fibers and they will start turning yellow/green and getting crusty/stiff. It doesn't catch fire and burst into flame...the heat just kinda starts deteriorating the material. So you really wouldn't want to like hold a pile of glowing red coals in your gloves. :-) But short of that, these gloves are great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rios

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cast Iron!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a Christmas present for my husband, a cast iron enthusiast. He loves restoring old cast iron he finds at yard sales etc. I thought these would help stop some of the flying curse words and small burns that were a part of removing hot cast iron from the grill or oven. They work great, and he loved wearing them when he cooked our Christmas roast in a cast iron dutch oven. I loved not having to shield my children from the language or having to do minor first aid on a holiday. Thank you, Grill Heat Aid, for saving Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected with a sponsored Amazon product
customer_reviews.text: No reflection on the seller. Upon reporting the failure of the item and prompt response and refund was applied. Situation: 3rd gentle use of the product. Cooking conditions were 300F moving cast iron dutch oven from grill to stovetop for serving. I know the temps because I use a Flameboss 300 wifi on my grill and the temps were maintained the entire cook. No moisture on the gloves pot handled for 30 seconds during transfer.
customer_reviews.author: Krugers

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as advertised for me.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad pair but product didn't work as advertised for me. I experienced an excessive amount of heat in 3 right hand fingertips when sliding the charcoal bins about 12" to the sides of my Weber charcoal kettle. Wasn't touching the charcoal, just the outside of the bins for a relatively short duration. The glove was not wet, and there was no steam or grease present...basically I had not even begun to cook anything. Anyway, refunded through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: For me, completely fireproof!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves replaced some old work gloves that I used on the grill, which weren't fireproof. These gloves are great if a little unwieldy, but..... their functionality trumps the slight lack of maneuverability. I picked up a hot coal, not smart, but dogs outside so had to protect their paws. gloves protected me 100%. Can't recommend highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: A. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves constantly when I BBQ. I dont know why I never bought a pair sooner. I am able to grab hot logs and also the grill. The gloves will get hot over time, but you need to keep in mind that they are not meant to hold extremely hot items past 10 seconds. Standard hot times you can hold longer. The only down side is that they will hold the smoke smell for a while, but eventually goes away or dies down.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco Hdz

customer_reviews.title: Requires tiny hands....
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to finally order these. So excited when they came. So disappointed when I tried to put one on. Holy cow! Who are they making these things for? Children? I couldn't barely get my hand in them - and certainly not all the way in. My fingers went in only about half-way into the finger holds. I don't have particularly large hands either. Result: totally useless. I plan to send them back unless they fit my wife's hands and she wants to keep them. So disappointed ):
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended heat resistant grilling gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, and perform exactly as advertised. Also, they come with instructions for use so that you don't accidentally misuse them and try to hold something too hot for too long, they give very clear instructions on how long it will take for heat to pass through. I love the gloves and they followup with an e-mail to you through Amazon that gives very clear cleaning instructions. Also great for use when baking in the kitchen or anytime you are near something hot. I've not used them in this fashion, but I would think they would also be great when working around your fireplace or wood burner in the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Wandering boy

customer_reviews.title: Works fine so far for cooking with my counter-top electric oven
customer_reviews.text: Works fine so far for cooking with my counter-top electric oven. The sticky feel of the pvc stripes are rather annoying. Definitely not one size fits all. The care instructions that come with the physical product is skimpy, and far less informative than those on the manufacturer's website. Finally, all the email addresses listed in the literatures that came with the product, getsatisfied@grillheataid.com and support@grillheataid.com do not work, as in: SMTP error, RCPT TO: 550-5.1.1 The email account that you tried to reach does not exist. Please try 550-5.1.1 double-checking the recipient's email address for typos or 550-5.1.1 unnecessary spaces. Learn more at 550 5.1.1  zf5si15795599obb.63 - gsmtp
customer_reviews.author: non soli cedit

customer_reviews.title: Best oven gloves I've had, heat didn't come through
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves! Couldn't believe that I could hold the baking dish in my hands when I took it from the oven. Usually it's a race to see how quickly I can get a pan out of the oven and set down because the heat came thru my previous gloves so fast. When I brought them out to use at Christmas dinner, the family was all over them, trying them on and "testing" them. I bought them large so my husband could use them also. He likes them so well, he felt he should keep them down with the Traeger and big Chief smokers. Very well made, love the black color.
customer_reviews.author: Cambar3

customer_reviews.title: Extra large did not fit average sized guys
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as grilling gifts for two adult male relatives. They appear to be of good quality, but both recipients found them to be tight and a little small, although advertised as extra large. These guys are averaged sized so they should have fit with room to spare. I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves but expected better heat protection at higher temps.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty Good Gloves! Allows finger articulation when working around the grill. I use them when I'm adding charcoal or wood to my smoker fire box. Not fully sold on the whole 900 degree thing though. I use a CharBroil IR Grill and the temps can get up into the 700s. When I use my metal vegetable tray, I can feel the heat through the gloves. From my grill to my kitchen it starts to get quite uncomfortable, as I can feel the metal handles burning through the glove. Doesn't damage the glove but I can feel the heat radiating through. Great for flipping meat in a high temperature environment. Also use them with my IR Fryer and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: cory d mooers

customer_reviews.title: Confidently work in the heat!
customer_reviews.text: My kids got these for me for Christmas. The first task for which they were used was pulling a dutch oven off of a big green egg - the grill temp was 350deg F and the gloves worked wonderfully. I've since used them for pulling other items off of the grill including a very large chicken pot pie. They might be a bit over powered for pulling items out of the kitchen oven but they would definitely perform well for that task. If you are looking for an item to protect your hands from a hot environment, these are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ismeeno1

customer_reviews.title: Do not work if there is steam.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves work wonderful if you are removing a dry, hot item from the oven. I love using them when I bake cookies. They do not work around steam though. I burned my hands while wearing these gloves when removing a turkey from the oven. The steam from the pan went right through the gloves and burned my hands
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a bad pair?
customer_reviews.text: Numerous friends suggested I get these gloves based on their expierences with them. I originally had a used pair that were great but the puppy couldn't resist her self and chewed them up so I bought a new pair. Haven't had the best of luck with the new pair. Maybe materials changed or production companies? Just be cautious and keep the aloe and burn cream ready.
customer_reviews.author: cody peterson

customer_reviews.title: These will burn your hands!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are garbage as they conduct waaaaay to much heat. I have burned my hands just picking up a cast iron skillet that was sitting in a 350F Kamado. Total junk. I have no idea why these have so many positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Luvwtr

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised....do not be fooled.
customer_reviews.text: I can barely make it from my deck to the door carrying a hot cast iron skillet without burning my hands. 900+ degree resistance? I don't think so. Too late for a return as well, I wish I would've bought a different pair. These aren't any better than a cheap oven mitt from Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work. Burned my wife's hand.
customer_reviews.text: Glove is defective. My wife was using it to handle a hot pan, but the gloves did not protect her. Her hand is burned and is now red. Very disappointed. Bought it due to high reviews. Makes me think that we got a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: EEDad123

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for smoker
customer_reviews.text: I liked these gloves. However, when the instructions say they are heat resistant for a short time, it is serious. We used them for the smoker. They work but you do need to work quickly when carrying something hot (grill grates). I gave them a four because when the gloves heat up, they heat up quickly and they "stay" hot, so the inside of the gloves sort of stick to you. It becomes difficult to get them off and you are stuck with the heat on your hands until you do. These gloves do work and they were good for what we needed them for, but they require caution.
customer_reviews.author: JRPHale

customer_reviews.title: Nice Snug Fit
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 5'-5"H, relatively slim build guy, and the "Small" was too small (for thinner fingers, more like it's my wife's size), and while the "One Size" fits nice & snug, compared to most others that are way too big/loose (My fingers are fat but short), since the finger tips are a bit long for me, these gloves feel more like for grabbing vs picking things up. Having said that, however, that is not the main use for these gloves, but for heat resistance, for which it helps greatly and even for handling BBQ tongs/tools or shifting grills, w/o feeling the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Rembrandt

customer_reviews.title: Great protection from the heat
customer_reviews.text: I was able to pick up a cast iron skillet directly from the grill and carry it inside with these gloves. The process took about 30 - 60 seconds, and I only started to feel some warmth through the gloves at the very end. I’m a 5’9” woman, so my hands are probably on the larger size for a woman, and these gloves were a little big on me; the fingers are about 1” too long on me. Not a big enough issue that it makes our use of them dangerous, though. Also love the long sleeves to protect your forearms!
customer_reviews.author: Jules the Streebs

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for gloves that were easy to clean, weren’t bulkier than needed, and would work with my grill grates etc. it doesn’t disappoint. I did use them to pick up my pizza oven lid, which was prob over 500F and did feel the heat in about 5seconds. The gloves aren’t designed for that temp, but they worked well enough for me to adjust the piece quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Great Option for Handling Hot Dishes
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up after purchasing my Traeger. Read through the reviews and saw several down comments but elected to take a chance on them. The gloves handle the heat perfectly fine as long as you don’t sit there and hold the dish forever. Cleaning them is easy, threw them in the washer and let them air dry. Putting them on was a common complaint, but they’re pretty easy, just like winter gloves. If they get wet, they can make handling hot dishes difficult, so best to keep them dry.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Good heat resistance.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... Looking at options for grill gloves... Even the most durable gloves only prove a few seconds of protection from extreme heat. So far I've been able to stick my hand directly into the fire for a few seconds and not felt a thing. (Please don't try.). We use them when camping and working the fire pit and making smores and for dumping charcoals into the smoker. They are working well so far. I am a bigger guy and they are a bit snug but they fit.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Didn't realize these were made for children?
customer_reviews.text: Look, I won't pretend to have large hands- average maybe? Would say on the smaller end of average for men- I'm 5'7" and wear 9.5 shoes. I can barely get my finger into the gloves because they're so small and they feel really tight which is ironic since the fingers are so long. It's pretty ridiculous really. No idea who these were designed for but they clearly weren't designed for people like me. Probably would fit Freddie Krueger great though?
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Turner

customer_reviews.title: reliably safe
customer_reviews.text: There are so many heat resistant gloves out there. How to choose? I have a cast iron Challenger Bread pan that has melted several oven mitts. Not these. I see why the Challenger folks recommended them. They are comfortable, grip well, and resist the heat when I take the pan from a 550 degree oven. Get the ones with long cuffs, you will appreciate the confidence as you reach into the hot oven. BTW, I thought I had posted a review similar to this yesterday, but can't find it. So, if this is a duplicate, I apologize.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Started to melt at relatively low temperature
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to use when grilling after reading many positive reviews on Amazon and third-party websites. My pair did not live up to the hype. The gloves are comfortable to wear, allowed great hand movement, and seem to be well-made. But when I simply touched a dry kettle warming on the stove top, the pinky of my left glove began to melt and discolor. The gloves were dry and the pot was not particularly hot. It certainly was not The 932° that these are supposed to be able to handle. Perhaps my pair was defective, but I am not willing to risk my hands to find out. These are being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: They are small!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they said size small and because they are cotton on the outside. I am a female with small hands. One size fits all leaves an inch extra for each finger. The fingers are a good length in these and cotton makes them more flexible. They are very tight getting on but I figure they will stretch out a little. They just arrived, so haven't given them the heat test, but I'm sure they will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: The Best Grill Gloves I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why anybody would buy those clumsy silicone gloves when they have access to these units. Superior in every way. I LOVE their extended length! Reaching over a blazing grill can be an unpleasant experience on the forearm in shorter, "regular" size gloves. Not a problem with these. All five fingers can move independently, much better than mitts. They are kinda "thick" at first, slightly hindering maneuverability but that's to be expected. A first-class product.
customer_reviews.author: Bic Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves worth the Investment
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a suede insulated glove that I bought from a big box hardware store for years.. Over the year it had become stiff and hard to bend when worn. My son turned me on to these gloves. My new grill can get very hot over 600 degrees. These gloves handle the heat very well and the are much more comfortable to wear. Picking up grill greats and accessories that are hot is very easy. These gloves are a must have for all pit masters.
customer_reviews.author: Everfam

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: We use this for the first time this weekend with our green egg smoker. As soon as my husband held the plate that was around 400°F the gloves melted literally on his hands and it burned! These are horrible they really don't work. And I'm not even sure if the plate was 400°F it may have been around 350°F. I can't even return them because the return window has passed.
customer_reviews.author: Josee from CA

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for BBQ and overall cooking
customer_reviews.text: Great for cooking! I bought these because I mounted a small peanuts butter factory and I created a peanuts roaster in stainless steel which runs on gas with BBQ burners. The roaster gets really hot and with these gloves you don't feel the heat at all, they protect your hands incredibly! I have even taken pans out of the stove and touched them where the flame was hitting and I didn't feel any hot from it. The only thing I would advise is to keep away from flames because these are made of fabric and may get in fire.
customer_reviews.author: Edser Solís

customer_reviews.title: Work well but cuffs are too tight
customer_reviews.text: As with all cloth-based gloves, it's important to not defeat the heat resistant qualities by making sure not to get them wet. Other than that, they work very well. My only complaint is that the wrist cuffs are designed for little 5'2" housewives, not giant BBQ Gods. In other words, they are very, very tight and impossible to get on without a lot of pulling. They are really tight. If you've got grease or BBQ sauce or whatever on the fingers, they're going to get dirty putting them on. I cut off 3" of the cuff to make them easier to get on, but they are already starting to fray. Big hands? Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: RB601

customer_reviews.title: No more heat resistant than any good oven mitt.
customer_reviews.text: I use them a lot at temps of around 500-600 F and it's absolutely no better than any other good quality oven mitts. Definitely not strong enough to keep the heat out. I don't believe for even a second that they could withstand temps over 1,000 F.
customer_reviews.author: Eliyahu E.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to the billing
customer_reviews.text: I've attached a picture showing you what happens when you touch a grill great of about 400° to 500°. The claims are bogus. It can't withstand heat anywhere near the published levels. I'm back to using my welder's glove with leather, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Dbar

customer_reviews.title: SCAM PRODUCT! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Warning! Do not buy!! These gloves are deceptively small and useless. They did not fit my husband’s average size hands and they did not fit my small hands! We bought the larger size. The fingers are so narrow that you can’t comfortably jam normal human fingers in there, let alone bend the ones lucky enough to make it in. Honestly, these are stunningly disappointing. We’re convinced these are among the many scam products that mimic actual well-made products. Do not buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I got these so I could carry hot cast iron pieces from my grill to the house. I grilled a steak in a cast iron skillet and when I tried to carry it to the house I almost dropped it in setting down midway because it was burning my hand literally. My wife came out with a sheet pan to relieve me and carried it into the house for me. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the heat, issue with the lining though.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the gloves with my smoker and it works great with handling the hot door, grills, and meat. The one complaint I have is about the lining. It was hard to get my fingers into the fingers of the gloves. It was very tight. Then when I tried to remove the gloves, the lining pulled out all the way. I had to get someone with smaller fingers to stuff it back inside the gloves. There should be a way to have the lining secured inside the finger slots so that it won’t pull inside out.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Work
customer_reviews.text: These don’t work very well. I have a smoker and grill and need heat protection when taking things off the smoker or when I sear something. You get maybe a minute or two before the heat starts to penetrate. What’s worse is once it does it holds the heat. Find another product that works
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One size dose not fit all.
customer_reviews.text: One size dose not fit all. The vendor was very nice when I contacted them, they suggested I try to stretch them out. Not even close. I tried what they suggested and it did not help. Okay spoiler. I am a firefighter and I expect my gloves to go on fast and easy. I guess I am spoiled. I just wanted to use these when cooking outside. They seem well made but I will never know if they work. If you have small to medium hands then this just be the glove for you.
customer_reviews.author: Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid glove for BBQ’n
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves just about every time I lite the pit and they work very well. Only thing I have a problem with is when taking them off, the inside layer slides out of the outside layer and is kind of aggrieved having to re adjust the inn glove back into the otter glove every time you put them on
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Making Pizza's on the Grill
customer_reviews.text: We made homemade pizza on the grill for the first time last night, and these gloves were the BOMB. Perfect for sliding the crust from the pizza board to the 500 degree grate, and then taking the crust off the grate. No heat was felt at all. I would recommend these for anyone who wanted a safe glove for grilling.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F.

customer_reviews.title: it's just a very thick glove with some silicon (I assume) spread over it like decorative sprinkles
customer_reviews.text: Lies. You can't hold anything hot with these for more than five seconds. Not pot handles, baking trays, the rack inside the oven-- nothing. It's not heat resistant, it's just a very thick glove with some silicon (I assume) spread over it like decorative sprinkles. Utterly useless as a mitt. However is good for stirring hot stuff if the steam bothers the skin on your hand and arms. But that's not why I bought this thing. It had one job, to be hot-proof. It's not.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried these with a BBQ on the grill, but they work great for everyday cooking and baking. When you grab a pan with them, you can't feel any heat through them at all. They're easy to wear, and they'll fit on either hand, so there's no trying to figure out which glove goes on which hand. Very comfortable, very well made. And they're long, covering more of the arm, which I appreciate. These are now my everyday cooking mitts.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Brannan

customer_reviews.title: Beware: gloves they are extremely small
customer_reviews.text: The gloves quality looks good. Unfortunately I didn't have a chance to try them. I have small hand with short and thin fingers and wear size L gloves (I like to have some space). The gloves are advertised as L-XL but I was barely able to put them on and after I put them on I couldn't even bend my fingers. It was so uncomfortable I returned them right away.
customer_reviews.author: sgi

customer_reviews.title: stupid!!!
customer_reviews.text: These clothes are trash!!! I tookoff the gloves as I would any other pair of gloves......bad Idea!!! Once you do that the layers become out of place making them useless because you can't get your fingersback in them!!! Upon finding this out I look for anything with company info so that I can call......that's when I discovered a little tag with small print that says how to take the gloves off, the average person will not see this and surely take them off as they would do any pair of gloves then the gloves are useless!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darick

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection to hands
customer_reviews.text: I am not a regular on grill so some time while using it in past I got small burns. I tired normal oven gloves but they are really small and not comfortable on hands. Wanna try something comfortable so found these. These are really comfortable and easy to sue. You can easily use spatula or skewers with these. These are washable. I not washed them yet as I just clean them with wet cloth for now.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Grill Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought these to help with my charcoal chimney. I don't have "chef hands" and worry about getting burned. These fit the bill. I have big hands and there is only one size for all. They are somewhat snug for my hands, but I'd imaging they would work great for most people. The label in the glove indicates they would protect up to 1400F. I hope I never stick my hand in something that hot. Great gloves, well constructed. No handing stitches.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C. Wieting

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but...
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find oven mitts for small hands, but these do fit well. They're fine for general use, but I have one recipe that is baked at 525 F for a short time and these only offer a few seconds of protection, but I'm still glad to have them Also the hanging loops could stand to be a tad longer.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: One size fits all if your hands are really small
customer_reviews.text: Super small and the gloves don't seem to be the same size. I can get most of my hand into one of them but the inside of the other has uneven fabric that makes it impossible to even get my fingers into them. When I buy sized gloves I wear large, not XL and I have to just give these to my wife or let them sit on the shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C

customer_reviews.title: Low heat resistance, hard to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: I’m exclusively using these to hold tongs when flipping food over our charcoal kettle grill. I am not touching the grill, I am not using them on open flame, I am simply holding tongs 1 to 2 feet from the charcoal embers. But after a couple minutes, the gloves are so hot I am getting burned through them. Terrible heat resistance, my basic kitchen mannies are better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Petonnet-Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Product seems OK but didn't fit me.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the XS based on other reviews, but they were too small for me. I have small women's hands, usually every glove I get is too big so I had high hopes. I knocked off 1 star since the white part of the glove was yellowing. I did not use them as I am returning, so I can not comment on their functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Just Love Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product, I grabbed a 600F grill screen
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product. My grill was over 600F and grabbed the grill off the Egg and then grabbed the flame deflector. I then just wanted to know, I grabbed the hard lumped charcoal, AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, Love these gloves! I have small hands (glove size 6) and have looked for small oven mitts for years. These are terrific!LOVE. Not only do they fit but I can reach into a 450 degree oven and pull out pans without feeling any heat. I have had no need to clean them yet.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Dedic

customer_reviews.title: ONE SIZE DOES NOT FIT ALL
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are supposed to be one size fits all but the fingers are very small. I can get the glove on but I have a hard time getting my fingers in them and then they are short and binding. They work as far as the heat goes but it sucks that I can't comfortably wear them. I'm a man with average size hands for a man. I wear a large to extra large work glove comfortably but these things are to small. We'll keep them for my wife but I'll have to get some different gloves for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Is not completely heat resistant as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the size small & they fit very snug which is what I wanted BUT the problem with these is they don’t work when taking a baking sheet out of the oven... it burned my fingers as soon as I grabbed the pan from the bottom (with one hand using my fingers to support the bottom). If using both hand & grabbing the side lip it’s ok. I’m giving 2 stars because it’s not what they are advertising as far as temperature resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Real work to take off and put on!
customer_reviews.text: These are very difficult to put on. There is an "inner glove" and the "inner fingers" pull out from the "outer fingers" and it becomes real work just to try to put my hand... especially fingers...back into the glove. My wife ordered these for me and chose the color to match my Big Green Egg. Not a good choice of color for handling things in a BBQ because of the typical black greasy residue, etc. Also, I feel a burning heat way to easy when I attempt to pick up the heat deflector when it's still hot...but the deflector is certainly not 932 degrees. That, I can deal with...but the finger issue is a real problem!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run Large for Most Women
customer_reviews.text: These gloves would be perfect if my hands were much larger or the gloves came in a smaller size. For a woman, they are way too big. I wish they came In size Small-Medium instead of only L-XL. They do protect my hands and lower arms from heat, but I don’t have fine finger/hand motor skills with so much extra finger room.
customer_reviews.author: Ceri

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw.  4 STARS
customer_reviews.text: The only place that's not protected, and where my wife burned her hand, is right where you need it most, like when you pick up a hot pot handle- between your thumb and 1st knuckle. There's no real insulation there, no blue stuff. She's fine, but I thought I was getting a "revolutionary" heat handler and what we got was similar to grabbing a flat potholder and hoping for the best. These are cool looking, and without a fairly slight but important design adjustment, they are just not cutting it.
customer_reviews.author: Cameraperson

customer_reviews.title: these gloves are good around the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Granted that the top temperature is not the working temperature, these gloves are good around the kitchen. They are much like the pair I had before which wore out. If you get these, be careful that you don't work with them when wet or greasy or the heat will wick to your hands very quickly. I had a greasy hand and removed one under my arm, the inside layer shifted and I had the darnedest time getting it back. It wasn't until I used the eraser end of a pencil that I could get my hand back into the gloves. The only thing I'd like on these is more thorough stitching to join the layers together.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Bohannon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: Previously I used yard work type leather gloves. Have now had the chance to use these heat resistant gloves for a couple of weekend grillings. Were a bit stiff the initial time but easier to get on the second weekend. Have found them to do as advertised in protecting from the heat of the fire. I cook with charcoal and because I only put coals under one side of the grilling rack, I do rotate the rack as part of the heat up / prep cycle. The process is now easier and have not encountered any heat that I used to with the leather gloves. Works quite well for what I wanted / needed.
customer_reviews.author: Soonerman

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves - highly recommended!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the first BBQ gloves that I've bought in my life -- and they're great! Gone are the days of holding bare hands over the hot grill and basting chicken, etc. I purchased these gloves based upon both the reviews and the specifications (heat resistant temperature) and I naturally liked have the flexibility of using one's fingers and not using an "oven mitt." So far I couldn't be happier with my purchase. The seller provides great product information on the use and care of the gloves. Don't forget to read all about how to wash and dry (no dryers!!). Remember: the number one reason for customer dissatisfaction with a product is failure to read the owner's manual!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Novak

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be the last pair of oven mitts I would buy, but still can't hold a cookie sheet for more than a few seconds without having to drop it. Back to the old school mitten shaped ones. Too bad as the glove shape was preferred
customer_reviews.author: TanK

customer_reviews.title: Great heat resistance
customer_reviews.text: These are Great. Got them yesterday and have already used them. Not at all bulky like I thought they’d be. No problems putting them on. Nice fit and I like that the cuff adds that little bit of protection to my arms when I reach in the oven. If you’ve ever accidentally touched your oven racks, you know what I mean! Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: These gloves will burn you. Literally.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the packaging saying the gloves will protect you up to 500 degrees Celsius, I just burned myself through these gloves when picking up a cast iron skillet over medium heat on my range. I hate having to use my oven mitts to hold my skillet, but I guess I’ll have too. Really disappointed these gloves didn’t live up to that expectation. I really like these gloves when working in my smoker, but the low heat (comparably) was hard to gauge how protective these are. Unfortunately, these cannot be my all-around, everyday heat protection gloves. I feel like there are probably better products out there if you’re actually looking for something to protect at moderate-high heats.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Good protection, Great product
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that the material is a little thinner than I would like. Don't get me wrong. This product most definitely protects your hands and wrists from burns, but your hand can get pretty uncomfortable if you don't put a hot item back down quickly. That said, I still highly recommend these gloves. They keep your hands AND your wrists safe, so no more little burns on your wrists while reaching for pans in the rear of the oven. And I have to say that my wife, who had a higher toletance for heat, doesn't experience any discomfort holding hot items while wearing these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Bollin

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I have reasonable sized hands, and I wear a large size rubber glove. However these gloves leave 3/4 of an inch to an inch above each of my fingers and thumb. The palm is similarly too large for me. I don’t know why it’s so hard to find gloves that fit a normal hand.
customer_reviews.author: David DelGreco

customer_reviews.title: One size does fit all - at least my size
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that my hands would be too big for these gloves, but that's not the case. I have only used them once, but I was able to move the heat diffuser in my smoker without any sensation of heat. So far so good. A few more grills under my belt - the gloves do seem to be a good job of keeping my hands from getting burned.
customer_reviews.author: Woodward

customer_reviews.title: These really work.
customer_reviews.text: These really work. I can pull things out of the oven and absolutely feel no heat. I cook pizza regularly at 500+ degrees and need to turn the pan or move it to a different baking steel. No problems holding the pan for the brief amount of time needed. Before it was precarious trying to use different items to do this. Not anymore. If you should have any items that you need dexterity managing, GET THESE...! I have not attempted to wash them yet. Should be simple enough. Also, they company provide follow up advise on cleaning tips. Great follow up - other companies should be so good.
customer_reviews.author: Texascook

customer_reviews.title: Prevents burns as it should
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife when she was getting frequent finger/wrist/forearm burns while working in the kitchen and being active in the oven. They've really worked well to stop so many of the burns that she was getting. Very useful for reaching into the oven, grabbing the item you need, and pulling your hand out without any negative impact.
customer_reviews.author: ESKeith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: These heat resistance gloves are perfect when doing Bar-B-Que, they are soft, flexible and easy to feel the items you are working with. I roasted some corn on the grill along with fish wrapped in foil and it was perfect to handle without utensils, I could easily feel the texture of the fish and know when they were fully cooked. I would recommend these to anyone who likes cooking on the grill.
customer_reviews.author: C.R.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the heat out, but does seem to melt some
customer_reviews.text: The rubber used for the non-slip is great out of the box, but with several uses they have melted some.. I am happy with the purchase and since I mainly use them at the campground to help with the fire and cooking over the fire its not a huge deal.. However I am curious if they would still perform as well even without the non-slip material to avoid the melting.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: I still feel the heat
customer_reviews.text: The good: I bought these for me when I smoke meats. Terrific. Even my wife loves them. I pan sear and have been burned, these not only have individual fingers but cover my wrists. The grip features are awesome. The bad: When I do pan sear, it is at 500 degrees Fahrenheit and I have to move fast because I don't have Mommy hands and can still feel the heat through these gloves when handling my cast iron skillets.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W.

customer_reviews.title: No more burns
customer_reviews.text: We have had NO burns in my kitchen since we got these. We cook with cast iron, which gets really hot, and these gloves are fantastic. They are far more convenient and easy to use than standard pot holders, and they eliminate gripping error (potholders sliding off handles and burning hands). I can't believe I didn't get these sooner! I did read the reviews about wet heat getting through, such as boiling water, which was great advice from other viewers. I solved this by having a second set on hand made of silicone, which are used for the "wet" heats. These gloves are used for everything else as they withstand a lot more heat, and are more comfortable in general.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer 007

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit really well, they are very flexible and not at all cumbersome to work with. It's like having on a pair of regular gloves that you can handle hot things with. The first time I used them was to remove a Pampered Chef cooking stone from the oven and if you've ever used these stones you know that they can get HOT but these gloves feel so natural that my mind was screaming "you're about to get burnt" but when I grabbed the stone there was nothing !!! Great quality I would recommend them
customer_reviews.author: James Lacombe

customer_reviews.title: Like magic!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful! We still have them and use them constantly. We bought them at least a couple of years ago and they still look like new! I use them to grab our iron skillets and iron griddle... not a burn at all! So very happy with them :)
customer_reviews.author: asdfan

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT serve the purpose at all.
customer_reviews.text: I used them while baking in our kitchen oven. The material did not protect my hands from the heat. Didn’t get burnt but I was scared to try them a second time. Cheap material. Definitely NOT meant for grill. Returning
customer_reviews.author: Dhruv Adawal

customer_reviews.title: Gloves Build Confidence
customer_reviews.text: Love these heat-resistant gloves. We recently began using a wood-burning stove to help heat our home, and I was nervous about sticking my hands into the stove's 400-500 degree fire box when adding or rearranging new fuel. These gloves are great. If blindfolded, I wouldn't have any idea that my gloved hands were near anything hot. This doesn't mean I leave my hands in the fire box any longer than is absolutely necessary; it just means that I have a few seconds where I can safely manage the fuel going into our stove. Note: The folks at Grill Heat Aid send a follow-up email that includes helpful reminders on how to best use and maintain your gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Palimpsest

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Gloves!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW. Amazing gloves. I own a pair of Napoleon gloves and these ones are by far better in terms of denying the heat & also are one size which makes it SUPER comfortable to use additional tools. I would def recommend on those and I will update my review in the future and discuss their durability.
customer_reviews.author: Rotem

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are great protection from high heat
customer_reviews.text: The firebox on my smoker creates a lot of heat. When it comes time to tend the coals and/or add more wood to the fire I always have these gloves on. They are comfortable to wear and really protect you from the heat. I will not smoke without them.
customer_reviews.author: Paulchjr

customer_reviews.title: Really nice gloves - especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my old Ove Gloves - which I loved - but they were getting on in years and I wanted something with longer cuffs and silicone grippies. I'll continue to use my old gloves for things like insulating my tea pot while it steeps, but these new gloves are fantastic! Width-wise and bulk-wise they are a tiny bit much for my hands, but that's my only complaint. The heat resistance is excellent and the grip is incredible, and those longer cuffs are great for reaching into a mid-sized toaster oven and not burning your wrists or forearms. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Arzey

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are nicely made and comfortable. On my electronic device the color appeared navy or black and white, they are medium-dark gray and white. This doesn't matter to me at all and I only mention it in case it does to someone else. I purchased the one-size but could have easily worn the ladies size; I thought that size was perhaps for really small hands but these are a very generous one-size. The fit isn't really an issue as they aren't meant for any precise detail work and then can also be worn by men in the household except perhaps for one with very large hands.
customer_reviews.author: DVM

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: i have bought several different grill gloves and these are the ONLY ones that are truly fire-resistant. I can pick up hot charcoals without burning my hands. I grill on a Weber Performer with baskets that the coals go in. Once they're lit, the coals are dumped into the grill and the baskets, which are hotter than I could imagine, are tossed out of the way. I can easily do this without burning my hands. All the other brands I have ordered last one or two times before they burn right thru. I would buy these over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: jigsaw

customer_reviews.title: Great heat protection for taking hot racks(275*) out of aircraft galley ovens.
customer_reviews.text: I’m using these gloves in the galley of an airplane to remove oven racks and place them in the meal carts to serve passengers. The only thing I didn’t like was that the fingers were so stiff that I had to keep taking one off each time I had to open a new oven. I haven’t cleaned them yet, so I’m hoping that they will relax a little and loosen up more.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Earhart

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: They are very heavy duty but my old glove does a much better job. These do work but you can not hold anything hot for very long which is why I bought them to protect from the heat. The longer arms are nice when you are pulling something hot out of the oven - just be sure you plan to set anything hot down quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Five stars!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had two occasions to use them and they worked flawlessly. I felt nothing and I got into the fire a bit once. As instructed DO NO GET THEM WET. They will get fantastically hot. Fortunately I read about this and dropped them when I got them wet. To the seller: Fast shipping, great packaging, reasonably priced, and Amazon convenience.
customer_reviews.author: sci f.

customer_reviews.title: Mystery reviews
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how this product earned over 80% positive reviews. I used the gloves simply to lift a stainless steel pot from the stove and instantly could feel the heat. I'd already discarded the wrapping so it's too late to return them, plan to donate to charity... maybe with a warning note.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Go to grilling gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality gloves. They seem very flexible and fit my large hands. I'm 6'4". I can use full function of my hands/fingers for latches and lids and utensils etc. I love how heat resistant they are. Up to 900 degrees F! These are going to be perfect for moving coals and wood. Good coverage also. The protection goes well past my wrists. Definitely my go to for the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Hill country love

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: The advertised features of these gloves were very convincing, and sounded like just what I needed, although a little expensive. The first time that I used them to TURN a skewer on a 450 degree grill the fabric burned as did my fingers (see photo). Only held the skewer for literally 2 seconds! 932 degree resistance? Not even close. Going back to the dollar store and buying a pile of throw-away pot holders. Don't fall for the false claims. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have small hands and the gloves are a bit large for me. I don't mind because with these gloves, I don't get burnt. I grill a fair amount and sometimes bake at high temperatures (pizza). I've had cloth mitts catch fire and I've melted silicone mitts and hotpads. These are the best heat-resistant protection yet. I've used them over six months and they still look new. I highly recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I would re-purchase these
customer_reviews.text: Another great gift for my spoiled hubby. He loves the gloves got them black to hide stains. Excellent quality, well-made and definitely heat resistant. I would re-purchase these
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice gloves and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and sturdy. It a little tight. Probably a perfect fit. I wear a large size glove. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JP of Sacramento

customer_reviews.title: Protective AND Flexible!
customer_reviews.text: Not only do these gloves do what they say they'll do, protect your hands from high heat, but they are almost as flexible a regular pair of gloves. Previously, I had purchased a pair of insulating gloves from another vendor. Those gloves protected my hands, but were so stiff they made it very difficult to manipulate hot items such as baking pans, etc. These Grill Heat Aid Gloves, on the other hand (pun intended), are so flexible that they can be used very nearly as an ordinary pair of garden gloves. I am very pleased and impressed with this purchase and with the very helpful follow-up emails I have received from the merchant SMM Group LLC. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Have a fireplace or wood stove? You need these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: One size gloves are thick and ample. I bought them for loading the wood stove / fireplace and adjusting the logs while burning. The gloves protect the hands, wrists, and extend a bit farther up the arm. Recommended for excellent heat protection!
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Currently I can only use the left glove but what a great product to have in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: As with so many people I too closed the" barn door after the horse got out". After severely burning my index finger on a broiler element I found your product on Amazon. I don't have to be struck by lighting I ordered a pair at once. Currently I can only use the left glove but what a great product to have in the kitchen. While waiting for deliver I received an email from your company thanking me for my order and explaining my soon to arrive product. (never done with any other purchase to date) They are a great value and a super investment in preventing an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Poor Richard

customer_reviews.title: used when smoking meat
customer_reviews.text: My son used the gloves while smoking some meat at my place, and said that they worked great! I bought these because of the higher temp protection. Have not washed them yet, but they look like they will do fine in the washer as instructed. Cannot be machine dried.
customer_reviews.author: CAB

customer_reviews.title: WAY WAY too small!!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today and I feel like O.J. at his trial. I can't even get my fingers in them. I don't have huge hands either. These are definitely made for small hands.
customer_reviews.author: David Billings

customer_reviews.title: A solid product you will want to give as a gift.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I've had the first for about 4 years and they are just now starting to wear out. I've given these as gifts and I'm going to order a smaller pair for my 10 year old who likes to help with cooking. As soon as I opened the package for these, I realized I really needed a second pair so I wasn't using one pair for campfires, grilling, and indoor cooking.
customer_reviews.author: AregularDad
